intro: Dryadodaphne novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea dryadodaphne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
